questions.question: In which year did the life of Jadav Payeng change?
On the banks of which river did Jadav live?
questions.answer: Brahmaputra

questions.question: How wide is the Brahmaputra river in some places?
questions.answer: 7-8 kilometres

questions.question: What is the name of the famous island in the Brahmaputra mentioned in the text?
questions.answer: Majuli island

questions.question: What terrible sight did Jadav see when he was 15 years old?
questions.answer: Thousands of dead snakes

questions.question: Why did the snakes die on the sandbar?

options.text: They had no trees to protect them from the sun

questions.answer: With no trees to protect them, they had all died in the scalding sun

questions.question: How many years did Jadav toil to transform the barren land into a forest?
questions.answer: For more than 30 long years

questions.question: What was Jadav Payeng's nickname used by his family?
questions.answer: Molai

questions.question: What did village elders advise Molai regarding the sandbars?

options.text: That nothing grows there and not to waste time

questions.answer: Molai, nothing grows on the sandbars. Don't waste your time

questions.question: Which plant was Molai first advised to try growing?
questions.answer: But someone told him to try growing bamboo

questions.question: What did Molai carry to the island to help the plants grow?
questions.answer: He even carried good soil in his little boat and spread it near the plants

questions.question: Why did Molai carry red ants to the island?

options.text: To make the sandy soil fertile

questions.answer: They would make the sandy soil fertile

questions.question: What is the meaning of 'Molai's Kathoni'?
questions.answer: People in that area named it Molai’s Kathoni - Molai’s forest

questions.question: How much area does Molai's Kathoni cover today?
questions.answer: Today, Molai’s Kathoni covers an area of nearly 1500 acres

questions.question: Which animals visiting the forest indicate it is in very good health?
questions.answer: The elephant visits show that the whole forest is in very good health

questions.question: What did Molai do when people wanted to cut down the trees?

options.text: He stood up in their defence like a rock

questions.answer: When people wanted to cut down the trees, he stood up in their defence like a rock

questions.question: What did the elephants destroy when they came to the area?
questions.answer: They destroyed the rice fields and huts

questions.question: How does Molai earn his living?
questions.answer: Molai keeps cattle for his own living

questions.question: Who discovered Molai's work and told the media?
questions.answer: One day, a photographer roaming in that area found Molai working in his forest

questions.question: Which award did the Government honour Molai with?
questions.answer: The Government honoured him with the Padma Shri award

questions.question: What is Molai's message to every person in the country?

options.text: To plant and grow at least two trees

questions.answer: Each one of us should plant and grow at least two trees

questions.question: According to the text, what do trees take care of for us?
questions.answer: The trees will take care of the carbon dioxide we produce

questions.question: Approximately how many square metres is one acre?
questions.answer: The acre is a unit of land area, which is approximately 4,047 square metres

questions.question: What did Molai say to the trees?
questions.answer: He spoke to them... words of affection

questions.question: Molai says he will go on planting trees until ________.

options.text: There is life in his body

questions.answer: I will go on planting trees till there is life in my body

questions.question: Where did Jadav Payeng live?
questions.answer: He lived in a small village on the banks of the Brahmaputra.

questions.question: What happens to the sandbars during floods?
questions.answer: Waters of the Brahmaputra often flood the sandbars, and at times, the river even sweeps some of them away.

questions.question: What made Jadav weep when he was 15?
questions.answer: He saw thousands of dead snakes on a sandbar that had died in the scalding sun because there were no trees to protect them.

questions.question: What was the mission Jadav found after seeing the dead snakes?
questions.answer: His mission was to turn the sandy barren land green with trees.

questions.question: What did Molai do when the Forest Department scheme work stopped?
questions.answer: While all the other labourers left, Molai decided to carry on the work all by himself.

questions.question: What saplings did the forest department first give Molai?
questions.answer: They gave him some bamboo saplings.

questions.question: What was the second type of sapling Molai brought to the island?
questions.answer: He brought silk cotton saplings next.

questions.question: How did Molai tend to the plants every day?
questions.answer: He watered the plants, made fences around them, and gave support to the saplings.

questions.question: Why did Molai carry red ants to the island despite the bites?
questions.answer: He believed they would make the sandy soil fertile.

questions.question: How did the trees respond to Molai's affection?
questions.answer: They responded by growing vigorously.

questions.question: How did more seeds reach the forest without Molai planting them?
questions.answer: Birds, insects, and animals that liked the place unknowingly brought many more seeds.

questions.question: Which large animals now live in Molai's Kathoni?
questions.answer: The forest houses deer, apes, rhinos, tigers, and a herd of elephants.

questions.question: How long does the elephant herd stay in the forest each year?
questions.answer: They stay there for about three months.

questions.question: What hardships did Molai face while working on the island?
questions.answer: He had to work in heavy rains and scorching heat.

questions.question: Who were the human threats to the forest?
questions.answer: The forest was threatened by poachers and people who wanted to cut down the trees.

questions.question: What did Molai tell those who wanted to cut the trees?
questions.answer: He warned them, 'You will have to cut me before you cut the trees!'

questions.question: Why did the villagers want to beat up Molai?
questions.answer: They were angry because his forest invited elephants that destroyed their rice fields and huts.

questions.question: How did the villagers eventually solve the elephant problem?
questions.answer: Most people left the area and shifted the village to make way for the elephants.

questions.question: Who supports Molai in his work today?
questions.answer: He has full support from his family, including his children who will carry on his work.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the Forest Department after Molai's work became famous?
questions.answer: The Forest Department was impressed and decided to help Molai in his work.

questions.question: What is the benefit of trees according to Molai's message?
questions.answer: Trees take care of carbon dioxide and give us enough oxygen to breathe.

questions.question: How does Molai describe the size of his 'house'?
questions.answer: He says his house is very big - hundreds of acres (referring to the forest).

questions.question: What is Molai's view on animals?
questions.answer: He asks why he should be afraid of them, as they are part of nature.

questions.question: What did Molai do to improve the soil on the island besides adding ants?
questions.answer: He carried good soil in his little boat and spread it near the plants.

questions.question: In what season did the dead snakes incident occur?
questions.answer: It happened in the terrible summer season of 1979.

questions.question: What does Molai say about man's knowledge of trees?
questions.answer: He says man knows how to cut a tree, but not how to plant it or grow it.

questions.question: What did Molai use to make the green patches thicker?
questions.answer: He took different types of grasses to the island.

questions.question: How did the media learn about Molai?
questions.answer: A photographer who found Molai told newspapers and TV channels about his achievement.

questions.question: Did Molai's family ask for anything in return for their support?
questions.answer: No, Molai says they supported him and did not ask for anything in return.

questions.question: What is the primary mission of Jadav Payeng?
questions.answer: To create and protect a 'green cover' for the land.
